intro: Erodium botrys f. gasparrinii, commonly known as the Gasparrini's filaree, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing small, rounded seed pods that contain several seeds. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. This variety is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract beneficial insects.
